  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;

                  <!---->:

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1. download asan-linux-release-1062625.zip and unzip<span class="line"><!---->1. download asan-linux-release-1062625.zip and unzip<!----></span><br>2. put poc.html, test.html, pay and web_manifest.json together and start a HTTPS server<span class="line"><!---->2. put poc.html, test.html, pay and web_manifest.json together and start a HTTPS server<!----></span><br>3. run `./chrome --incognito <span class="line"><!---->3. run `./chrome --incognito <!----></span>http://localhost/test.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost/test.html`"><!---->http://localhost/test.html`<!----></a><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>This is caused by the incomplete fix of <span class="line"><!---->This is caused by the incomplete fix of <!----></span>issue 1366806<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1366806" title="Security: Heap-use-after-free in InstallablePaymentAppCrawler::OnPaymentMethodManifestParsed"><!---->issue 1366806<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br>This is the commit that fix <span class="line"><!---->This is the commit that fix <!----></span>issue 1366806<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1366806" title="Security: Heap-use-after-free in InstallablePaymentAppCrawler::OnPaymentMethodManifestParsed"><!---->issue 1366806<!----></a>: <span class="line"><!---->: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3920030<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3920030"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3920030<!----></a><br>This problem is introduced in this commit: <span class="line"><!---->This problem is introduced in this commit: <!----></span>21ae413b543e464de8646164d05325f2f86656f7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/21ae413b543e464de8646164d05325f2f86656f7"><!---->21ae413b543e464de8646164d05325f2f86656f7<!----></a><br><br>Now, the dev channel is updated to 108.0.5359.10, so this vulnerability affect the dev channel of chrome. And I've verified that in dev.webm, if you want to verify that, please use test_dev.html, it refreshes more frequently.<span class="line"><!---->Now, the dev channel is updated to 108.0.5359.10, so this vulnerability affect the dev channel of chrome. And I've verified that in dev.webm, if you want to verify that, please use test_dev.html, it refreshes more frequently.<!----></span><br>The Beta channel is updated to 107.0.5304.62, so it is not affected by this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The Beta channel is updated to 107.0.5304.62, so it is not affected by this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br>1. Analysis<span class="line"><!---->1. Analysis<!----></span><br><br>As mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->As mentioned in <!----></span>issue 1366806<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1366806" title="Security: Heap-use-after-free in InstallablePaymentAppCrawler::OnPaymentMethodManifestParsed"><!---->issue 1366806<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>`downloader_->DownloadWebAppManifest`[1] can call `PaymentManifestDownloader::InitiateDownload` and reset `this`. And the patch assume that "only the last iteration of the loop can result in a deletion, as `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` must be zero"(1). If the assume is correct, `this` can only be deleted after loop, everything will be OK.<span class="line"><!---->`downloader_-&gt;DownloadWebAppManifest`[1] can call `PaymentManifestDownloader::InitiateDownload` and reset `this`. And the patch assume that "only the last iteration of the loop can result in a deletion, as `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` must be zero"(1). If the assume is correct, `this` can only be deleted after loop, everything will be OK.<!----></span><br><br>However, I find the implement of this logic is not correct. `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` is added just before `downloader_->DownloadWebAppManifest`. Considering there are two elements in this loop, for the first one, when the code run into `downloader_->DownloadWebAppManifest`, the `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` will be ONE(2), and `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` will be decrease by ONE in `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded`[2] immediately! If the `content` is empty, `FinishCrawlingPaymentAppsIfReady` will delete `this` because the `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` is already be ZERO(3). <span class="line"><!---->However, I find the implement of this logic is not correct. `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` is added just before `downloader_-&gt;DownloadWebAppManifest`. Considering there are two elements in this loop, for the first one, when the code run into `downloader_-&gt;DownloadWebAppManifest`, the `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` will be ONE(2), and `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` will be decrease by ONE in `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded`[2] immediately! If the `content` is empty, `FinishCrawlingPaymentAppsIfReady` will delete `this` because the `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` is already be ZERO(3). <!----></span><br>So, if the `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded` is executed before traversing the second element, `this` will be deleted and continue running will cause UAF.<span class="line"><!---->So, if the `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded` is executed before traversing the second element, `this` will be deleted and continue running will cause UAF.<!----></span><br><br>```[1]<span class="line"><!---->```[1]<!----></span><br>void InstallablePaymentAppCrawler::OnPaymentMethodManifestParsed(<span class="line"><!---->void InstallablePaymentAppCrawler::OnPaymentMethodManifestParsed(<!----></span><br>    const GURL& method_manifest_url,<span class="line"><!---->    const GURL&amp; method_manifest_url,<!----></span><br>    const GURL& method_manifest_url_after_redirects,<span class="line"><!---->    const GURL&amp; method_manifest_url_after_redirects,<!----></span><br>    const std::string& content,<span class="line"><!---->    const std::string&amp; content,<!----></span><br>    const std::vector<GURL>& default_applications,<span class="line"><!---->    const std::vector&lt;GURL&gt;&amp; default_applications,<!----></span><br>    const std::vector<url::Origin>& supported_origins) {<span class="line"><!---->    const std::vector&lt;url::Origin&gt;&amp; supported_origins) {<!----></span><br>  number_of_payment_method_manifest_to_parse_--;<span class="line"><!---->  number_of_payment_method_manifest_to_parse_--;<!----></span><br><br>  auto* rfh = content::RenderFrameHost::FromID(initiator_frame_routing_id_);<span class="line"><!---->  auto* rfh = content::RenderFrameHost::FromID(initiator_frame_routing_id_);<!----></span><br>  if (!rfh)<span class="line"><!---->  if (!rfh)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br><br>  content::PermissionController* permission_controller =<span class="line"><!---->  content::PermissionController* permission_controller =<!----></span><br>      rfh->GetBrowserContext()->GetPermissionController();<span class="line"><!---->      rfh-&gt;GetBrowserContext()-&gt;GetPermissionController();<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(permission_controller);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(permission_controller);<!----></span><br><br>  // If there are no valid entries in default_applications, this task will<span class="line"><!---->  // If there are no valid entries in default_applications, this task will<!----></span><br>  // finish the crawling.<span class="line"><!---->  // finish the crawling.<!----></span><br>  PostTaskToFinishCrawlingPaymentAppsIfReady();<span class="line"><!---->  PostTaskToFinishCrawlingPaymentAppsIfReady();<!----></span><br><br>  // The `DownloadWebAppManifest()` method may synchronously call<span class="line"><!---->  // The `DownloadWebAppManifest()` method may synchronously call<!----></span><br>  // `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded()`, e.g., if the owning page has gone<span class="line"><!---->  // `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded()`, e.g., if the owning page has gone<!----></span><br>  // away already. This may result in this InstallablePaymentAppCrawler object<span class="line"><!---->  // away already. This may result in this InstallablePaymentAppCrawler object<!----></span><br>  // to be deleted, so no code should be run after this loop.<span class="line"><!---->  // to be deleted, so no code should be run after this loop.<!----></span><br>  //<span class="line"><!---->  //<!----></span><br>  // Note that only the last iteration of the loop can result in a deletion, as<span class="line"><!---->  // Note that only the last iteration of the loop can result in a deletion, as<!----></span><br>  // `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` must be zero.<span class="line"><!---->  // `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` must be zero.<!----></span><br>  for (const auto& web_app_manifest_url : default_applications) {   // (1) <span class="line"><!---->  for (const auto&amp; web_app_manifest_url : default_applications) {   // (1) <!----></span><br>    if (downloaded_web_app_manifests_.find(web_app_manifest_url) !=<span class="line"><!---->    if (downloaded_web_app_manifests_.find(web_app_manifest_url) !=<!----></span><br>        downloaded_web_app_manifests_.end()) {<span class="line"><!---->        downloaded_web_app_manifests_.end()) {<!----></span><br>      // Do not download the same web app manifest again since a web app could<span class="line"><!---->      // Do not download the same web app manifest again since a web app could<!----></span><br>      // be the default application of multiple payment methods.<span class="line"><!---->      // be the default application of multiple payment methods.<!----></span><br>      continue;<span class="line"><!---->      continue;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    if (!IsSameOriginWith(method_manifest_url_after_redirects,<span class="line"><!---->    if (!IsSameOriginWith(method_manifest_url_after_redirects,<!----></span><br>                          web_app_manifest_url)) {<span class="line"><!---->                          web_app_manifest_url)) {<!----></span><br>      std::string error_message = base::ReplaceStringPlaceholders(<span class="line"><!---->      std::string error_message = base::ReplaceStringPlaceholders(<!----></span><br>          errors::kCrossOriginWebAppManifestNotAllowed,<span class="line"><!---->          errors::kCrossOriginWebAppManifestNotAllowed,<!----></span><br>          {web_app_manifest_url.spec(),<span class="line"><!---->          {web_app_manifest_url.spec(),<!----></span><br>           method_manifest_url_after_redirects.spec()},<span class="line"><!---->           method_manifest_url_after_redirects.spec()},<!----></span><br>          nullptr);<span class="line"><!---->          nullptr);<!----></span><br>      SetFirstError(error_message);<span class="line"><!---->      SetFirstError(error_message);<!----></span><br>      continue;<span class="line"><!---->      continue;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    if (permission_controller<span class="line"><!---->    if (permission_controller<!----></span><br>            ->GetPermissionResultForOriginWithoutContext(<span class="line"><!---->            -&gt;GetPermissionResultForOriginWithoutContext(<!----></span><br>                blink::PermissionType::PAYMENT_HANDLER,<span class="line"><!---->                blink::PermissionType::PAYMENT_HANDLER,<!----></span><br>                url::Origin::Create(web_app_manifest_url))<span class="line"><!---->                url::Origin::Create(web_app_manifest_url))<!----></span><br>            .status != blink::mojom::PermissionStatus::GRANTED) {<span class="line"><!---->            .status != blink::mojom::PermissionStatus::GRANTED) {<!----></span><br>      // Do not download the web app manifest if it is blocked.<span class="line"><!---->      // Do not download the web app manifest if it is blocked.<!----></span><br>      continue;<span class="line"><!---->      continue;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_++;   // (2) number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_ is increased by one <span class="line"><!---->    number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_++;   // (2) number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_ is increased by one <!----></span><br>    downloaded_web_app_manifests_.insert(web_app_manifest_url);<span POC<span class="line"><!---->2. POC<!----></span><br>To get more than one element in `default_applications`, I use my onw `pay` and `web_manifest.json` file. You can see that in file `pay`, there are many `default_applications`.<span class="line"><!---->To get more than one element in `default_applications`, I use my onw `pay` and `web_manifest.json` file. You can see that in file `pay`, there are many `default_applications`.<!----></span><br><br>3. Patch<span class="line"><!---->3. Patch<!----></span><br>I think `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` should be assigned the size of `default_applications`, and decrease it in `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded` or when the loop continue.<span class="line"><!---->I think `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` should be assigned the size of `default_applications`, and decrease it in `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded` or when the loop continue.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/components/payments/content/installable_payment_app_crawler.cc         Merge review required: M108 is already shipping to beta.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M108 is already shipping to beta.<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<!----></span><br>1. Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<span class="line"><!---->1. Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<!----></span><br>- Chrome Browser: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Browser: <!----></span>https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches"><!---->https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. What changes specifically would you like to merge? Please link to Gerrit.<span class="line"><!---->2. What changes specifically would you like to merge? Please link to Gerrit.<!----></span><br>3. Have the changes been released and tested on canary?<span class="line"><!---->3. Have the changes been released and tested on canary?<!----></span><br>4. Is this a new feature? If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<span class="line"><!---->4. Is this a new feature? If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<!----></span><br>5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <span class="line"><!---->5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br>6. 2+ web app manifests<span class="line"><!---->[Web Payments] Avoid early deletion of crawler for 2+ web app manifests<!----></span><br><br>The previous fix[0] overlooked that<span class="line"><!---->The previous fix[0] overlooked that<!----></span><br>number_of_payment_method_manifest_to_download_ could be synchronously<span class="line"><!---->number_of_payment_method_manifest_to_download_ could be synchronously<!----></span><br>reduced to 0 during the loop, as opposed to only in the last iteration.<span class="line"><!---->reduced to 0 during the loop, as opposed to only in the last iteration.<!----></span><br>This CL corrects that, by pre-allocating<span class="line"><!---->This CL corrects that, by pre-allocating<!----></span><br>number_of_payment_method_manifest_to_download_ ahead of the loop and<span class="line"><!---->number_of_payment_method_manifest_to_download_ ahead of the loop and<!----></span><br>decrementing it every loop iteration. As such, only the last iteration<span class="line"><!---->decrementing it every loop iteration. As such, only the last iteration<!----></span><br>should be able to have it reduced to zero.<span class="line"><!---->should be able to have it reduced to zero.<!----></span><br><br>[0]: <span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-error hidden=""><!----><!----></mr-error>
        
          
       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>
    Send email<chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Discard
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1378286%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D1600" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1378286%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D1600%252526ust%25253D1703402469761612%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw3S32-E2-CQ20PPfF_FOK0I%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          }

            width: 100%;

            border: 0;
          }

            flex-direction: column;
          }

            width: 100%;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script>

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);

    text-decoration: underline;

  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);

  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      merc....@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2374874189" title="merc....@gmail.com"><!---->merc....@gmail.com<!----></a>
      merc....@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->merc....@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

            on 
      Tue, Oct 25, 2022, 12:00 PM EDT

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1. download asan-linux-release-1062625.zip and unzip<span class="line"><!---->1. download asan-linux-release-1062625.zip and unzip<!----></span><br>2. put poc.html, test.html, pay and web_manifest.json together and start a HTTPS server<span class="line"><!---->2. put poc.html, test.html, pay and web_manifest.json together and start a HTTPS server<!----></span><br>3. run `./chrome --incognito <span class="line"><!---->3. run `./chrome --incognito <!----></span>http://localhost/test.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost/test.html`"><!---->http://localhost/test.html`<!----></a><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>This is caused by the incomplete fix of <span class="line"><!---->This is caused by the incomplete fix of <!----></span>issue 1366806<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1366806" title="Security: Heap-use-after-free in InstallablePaymentAppCrawler::OnPaymentMethodManifestParsed"><!---->issue 1366806<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br>This is the commit that fix <span class="line"><!---->This is the commit that fix <!----></span>issue 1366806<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1366806" title="Security: Heap-use-after-free in InstallablePaymentAppCrawler::OnPaymentMethodManifestParsed"><!---->issue 1366806<!----></a>: <span class="line"><!---->: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3920030<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3920030"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3920030<!----></a><br>This problem is introduced in this commit: <span class="line"><!---->This problem is introduced in this commit: <!----></span>21ae413b543e464de8646164d05325f2f86656f7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/21ae413b543e464de8646164d05325f2f86656f7"><!---->21ae413b543e464de8646164d05325f2f86656f7<!----></a><br><br>Now, the dev channel is updated to 108.0.5359.10, so this vulnerability affect the dev channel of chrome. And I've verified that in dev.webm, if you want to verify that, please use test_dev.html, it refreshes more frequently.<span class="line"><!---->Now, the dev channel is updated to 108.0.5359.10, so this vulnerability affect the dev channel of chrome. And I've verified that in dev.webm, if you want to verify that, please use test_dev.html, it refreshes more frequently.<!----></span><br>The Beta channel is updated to 107.0.5304.62, so it is not affected by this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The Beta channel is updated to 107.0.5304.62, so it is not affected by this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br>1. Analysis<span class="line"><!---->1. Analysis<!----></span><br><br>As mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->As mentioned in <!----></span>issue 1366806<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1366806" title="Security: Heap-use-after-free in InstallablePaymentAppCrawler::OnPaymentMethodManifestParsed"><!---->issue 1366806<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>`downloader_->DownloadWebAppManifest`[1] can call `PaymentManifestDownloader::InitiateDownload` and reset `this`. And the patch assume that "only the last iteration of the loop can result in a deletion, as `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` must be zero"(1). If the assume is correct, `this` can only be deleted after loop, everything will be OK.<span class="line"><!---->`downloader_-&gt;DownloadWebAppManifest`[1] can call `PaymentManifestDownloader::InitiateDownload` and reset `this`. And the patch assume that "only the last iteration of the loop can result in a deletion, as `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` must be zero"(1). If the assume is correct, `this` can only be deleted after loop, everything will be OK.<!----></span><br><br>However, I find the implement of this logic is not correct. `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` is added just before `downloader_->DownloadWebAppManifest`. Considering there are two elements in this loop, for the first one, when the code run into `downloader_->DownloadWebAppManifest`, the `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` will be ONE(2), and `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` will be decrease by ONE in `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded`[2] immediately! If the `content` is empty, `FinishCrawlingPaymentAppsIfReady` will delete `this` because the `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` is already be ZERO(3). <span class="line"><!---->However, I find the implement of this logic is not correct. `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` is added just before `downloader_-&gt;DownloadWebAppManifest`. Considering there are two elements in this loop, for the first one, when the code run into `downloader_-&gt;DownloadWebAppManifest`, the `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` will be ONE(2), and `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` will be decrease by ONE in `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded`[2] immediately! If the `content` is empty, `FinishCrawlingPaymentAppsIfReady` will delete `this` because the `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` is already be ZERO(3). <!----></span><br>So, if the `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded` is executed before traversing the second element, `this` will be deleted and continue running will cause UAF.<span class="line"><!---->So, if the `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded` is executed before traversing the second element, `this` will be deleted and continue running will cause UAF.<!----></span><br><br>```[1]<span class="line"><!---->```[1]<!----></span><br>void InstallablePaymentAppCrawler::OnPaymentMethodManifestParsed(<span class="line"><!---->void InstallablePaymentAppCrawler::OnPaymentMethodManifestParsed(<!----></span><br>    const GURL& method_manifest_url,<span class="line"><!---->    const GURL&amp; <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/payments/content/installable_payment_app_crawler.cc;l=217;drc=7f00d813a79f51a6c77797cdaa33b56cce340a33;bpv=0;bpt=0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/payments/content/installable_payment_app_crawler.cc;l=244;drc=7f00d813a79f51a6c77797cdaa33b56cce340a33;bpv=0;bpt=0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" POC<span class="line"><!---->2. POC<!----></span><br>To get more than one element in `default_applications`, I use my onw `pay` and `web_manifest.json` file. You can see that in file `pay`, there are many `default_applications`.<span class="line"><!---->To get more than one element in `default_applications`, I use my onw `pay` and `web_manifest.json` file. You can see that in file `pay`, there are many `default_applications`.<!----></span><br><br>3. Patch<span class="line"><!---->3. Patch<!----></span><br>I think `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` should be assigned the size of `default_applications`, and decrease it in `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded` or when the loop continue.<span class="line"><!---->I think `number_of_web_app_manifest_to_download_` should be assigned the size of `default_applications`, and decrease it in `OnPaymentWebAppManifestDownloaded` or when the loop continue.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/components/payments/content/installable_payment_app_crawler.cc b/components/payments/content/installable_payment_app_crawler.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/components/payments/content/installable_payment_app_crawler.cc -174,11 +174,13 @@ void InstallablePaymentAppCrawler::OnPaymentMethodManifestParsed(<!----></span><br>   //<span class="line"><!---->   //<!----></span><br>   // Note that only the last iteration of the loop can result in a deletion, as<span class="line"><!---->   // Note that only the last iteration of the loop can result in a deletion, as<!----></span><br>   // <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/c5c1f9cf8c9a715c481ece9fdf87efb7b2c149cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>c5c1f9cf8c9a715c481ece9fdf87efb7b2c149cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c5c1f9cf8c9a715c481ece9fdf87efb7b2c149cc"><!---->c5c1f9cf8c9a715c481ece9fdf87efb7b2c149cc<!----></a><br>Author: Stephen McGruer <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Stephen McGruer &lt;<!----></span>smcgruer@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/smcgruer@chromium.org"><!---->smcgruer@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Oct 26 17:14:35 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Oct 26 17:14:35 2022<!----></span><br><br>[Web Payments] Avoid early deletion of crawler for 2+ web app manifests<span class="line"><!---->[Web Payments] Avoid early deletion of crawler for 2+ web app manifests<!----></span><br><br>The previous fix[0] overlooked that<span class="line"><!---->The previous fix[0] overlooked that<!----></span><br>number_of_payment_method_manifest_to_download_ could be synchronously<span class="line"><!---->number_of_payment_method_manifest_to_download_ could be synchronously<!----></span><br>reduced to 0 during the loop, as opposed to only in the last iteration.<span class="line"><!---->reduced to 0 during the loop, as opposed to only in the last iteration.<!----></span><br>This CL corrects that, by pre-allocating<span class="line"><!---->This CL corrects that, by pre-allocating<!----></span><br>number_of_payment_method_manifest_to_download_ ahead of the loop and<span class="line"><!---->number_of_payment_method_manifest_to_download_ ahead of the loop and<!----></span><br>decrementing it every loop iteration. As such, only the last iteration<span class="line"><!---->decrementing it every loop iteration. As such, only the last iteration<!----></span><br>should be able to have it reduced to zero.<span class="line"><!---->should be able to have it reduced to zero.<!----></span><br><br>[0]: <span class="line"><!---->[0]: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3920030<a class="undefined" target="_blank" and<!----></span><br>decrementing it every loop iteration. As such, only the last iteration<span class="line"><!---->decrementing it every loop iteration. (Temporarily hosted at <span class="line"><!---->ASAN Reproduction: So far unable to reproduce with a hosted version of the OP's repro. (Temporarily hosted at <!----></span>https://rsolomakhin.github.io/pr/1378286/test_dev.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://rsolomakhin.github.io/pr/1378286/test_dev.html"><!---->https://rsolomakhin.github.io/pr/1378286/test_dev.html<!----></a>).<span class="line"><!---->).<!----></span> This is likely due to timing issues, as we were able to reproduce the UAF via C++ browser tests and believe that a website *could* trigger it if the timing was right, but does mean its hard to verify the fix outside of the C++ browser tests.<span class="line"><!----> This is likely due to timing issues, as we were able to reproduce the UAF via C++ browser tests and believe that a website *could* trigger it if the timing was right, but does mean its hard to verify the fix outside of the C++ browser tests.<!----></span><br><br>We are continuing to work on trying to reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->We are continuing to work on trying to reproduce:<!----></span><br><br>~/Downloads/asan-linux-release-1062625/chrome <span class="line"><!---->~/Downloads/asan-linux-release-1062625/chrome <!----></span>https://rsolomakhin.github.io/pr/1378286/test_dev.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://rsolomakhin.github.io/pr/1378286/test_dev.html"><!---->https://rsolomakhin.github.io/pr/1378286/test_dev.html<!----></a><br><br>(And once we do, will then verify that a newer asan release with the fix **doesn't** reproduce)<span class="line"><!---->(And once we do, will then verify that a newer asan release with the fix **doesn't** reproduce)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We continue to be unable to reproduce this using web-platform means (i.e. the reporters original repro html) unfortunately. As noted above however, we are reasonably confident that:<span class="line"><!---->We continue to be unable to reproduce this using web-platform means (i.e. the reporters original repro html) unfortunately. As noted above however, we are reasonably confident that:<!----></span><br><br>- A UAF existed (confirmed via code analysis and new browser tests)<span class="line"><!---->- A UAF existed (confirmed via code analysis and new browser tests)<!----></span><br>- It should be fixed (confirmed via same browser tests)<span class="line"><!---->- It should be fixed (confirmed via same browser tests)<!----></span><br>- It would have been possible to trigger via a website navigating an iframe (though the timing seems very tight)<span class="line"><!---->- It would have been possible to trigger via a website navigating an iframe (though the timing seems very tight)<!----></span><br><br>We are also fairly confident that the fix hasn't broken PaymentHandler either, based on smoke tests on Canary builds.<span class="line"><!---->We are also fairly confident that the fix hasn't broken PaymentHandler either, based on smoke tests on Canary builds.<!----></span><br><br>As such, marking Fixed. We should merge to M108 imo (govind@ - will you take lead on this?), and start on the postmortem on our side.<span class="line"><!---->As such, marking Fixed. We should merge to M108 imo (govind@ - will you take lead on this?), and start on the postmortem on our side.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

and<!----></span><br>decrementing it every loop iteration. As such, only the last iteration<span class="line"><!---->decrementing it every loop iteration.         This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<span class="line"><!---->This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<!----></span><br><br>1. Number of CLs needed for this fix and links to them.<span class="line"><!---->1.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    Send email<chops-checkbox checked="true">Send email</chops-checkbox>

          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              <mr-launch-overview class="main-item" hidden=""><!---->

          max-width: 100%;
